# RV Project - Copilot Instructions

## Project Overview
RV is a project in its early stages. This repository will contain the core application code and related resources. Contributors should follow the guidelines below to maintain consistency and quality.

## Technology Stack
- Language: To be determined based on project needs
- Build tools: To be defined as the project evolves
- Testing framework: To be established with initial implementation

## Coding Guidelines
- Write clean, readable, and maintainable code
- Follow language-specific best practices and style guides
- Include comments for complex logic and non-obvious implementations
- Use meaningful variable and function names that clearly convey purpose
- Prefer modularity and reusability in code design
- Keep functions focused on a single responsibility

## Project Structure
```
/
├── .github/           # GitHub configuration and workflows
├── README.md          # Project documentation
└── (additional directories to be added as project develops)
```

## Testing Instructions
- All new features should include appropriate test coverage
- Tests should be clear, focused, and maintainable
- Use descriptive test names that explain what is being tested
- Mock external dependencies appropriately
- Ensure tests are deterministic and don't rely on external state

## Documentation
- Update README.md when adding significant features or changes
- Document APIs, interfaces, and public functions
- Include usage examples for complex features
- Keep documentation in sync with code changes

## Security Considerations
- Never commit secrets, API keys, or sensitive credentials
- Validate and sanitize all user inputs
- Follow security best practices for the chosen technology stack
- Review dependencies for known vulnerabilities before adding them

## Pull Request Guidelines
- Create focused PRs that address a single concern
- Write clear PR descriptions explaining what and why
- Ensure all tests pass before requesting review
- Address review feedback promptly and thoughtfully

## References
- [README.md](../README.md) - Project overview and setup instructions

---

_Note: These instructions will be updated as the project evolves and more specific requirements are established._
